props.synopsis: The 23-year-old university student from Melbourne has been found in "good health" after he went missing in dense bushland in the NSW Snowy Mountains on Boxing Day.

title.children: Missing hiker 'survived on two muesli bars' during 13 days in the bush

image.altText: a school with a large sign reading st john paul ii college

props.synopsis: Parents of students attending Catholic and independent secondary schools in the ACT are facing school fee increases in 2025, including some by as much as 15 and 30 per cent.

title.children: Some ACT private schools facing fee increases as costs rise

image.altText: A close-up shot of a doctor noting down symptoms of a patient on a form with a stethoscope hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor has been accused of discrimination for cancelling a teenage transgender patient's routine appointment for adolescent vaccinations.

title.children: Human rights complaint made after transgender teen's GP visit cancelled

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Police say they also received a call from a university student who wanted their professor's contact details to request a deadline extension and a man who wanted a stray cat on his street to be arrested.

title.children: Calls to triple-0 included teen who lost internet, man who wanted stray cat arrested

image.altText: Dozens of cars and three helicopters on a road

props.synopsis: More than half a dozen people have been injured in the incident along the Hume Highway near Goulburn.

title.children: Two airlifted to hospital after van rollover on Hume Highway

image.altText: Woman lying in curled up position on couch.

props.synopsis: The researchers hope their project can be used to build a profile of endometriosis sufferers.

title.children: No 'cure' but research could improve life for endometriosis patients

image.altText: A man with brown hair and a moustache wearing a neck brace gives a thumbs up from a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Professional cyclist Jay Vine aims to claim his second Tour Down Under title after recovering from a life-threatening crash.

title.children: Jay Vine sets sights on second title after life-threatening crash

image.altText: A collapsed house and stairwell still partially on fire with an open roof.

props.synopsis: Uncontrolled wildfires raging across Southern California have killed two people and destroyed at least 1,000 homes, with celebrities among those forced to evacuate. Follow live.

title.children: Hundreds of luxury homes razed as Palisades fire becomes most destructive in LA's history

image.altText: A silhouette of a firefighter standing in front of a huge flame, at night

props.synopsis: Uncontrolled wildfires across Southern California have destroyed at least 1,000 homes, with celebrities among those forced to evacuate. Follow live.

title.children: Two dead and hundreds of LA homes destroyed as firefighters battle blaze in Pacific Palisades

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Pacific Palisades fire overtakes 2008 Sayre fire as most destructive

image.altText: two stills from a phone video showing some cricket fans chanting at the MCG

props.synopsis: A video that appears to show some fans engaging in a racist chant at Melbourne's Boxing Day Test has been circulating online and made headlines in India, with members of Melbourne's Indian community saying the incident was "not appropriate".

title.children: MCG 'extremely disappointed' over racist chant at Boxing Day Test

image.altText: Hadi Nazari was reported missing in the Kosciuszko National Park on Boxing Day

props.synopsis: After almost two weeks lost in bushland, hiker Hadi Nazari is now recovering in Cooma hospital, with his friends describing it as a "miracle".

title.children: Missing hiker recorded emotional message on camera before being found

image.altText: Andrew Forrest holding his chin at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Andrew Forrest and his charity IEJF have been accused in a defamation lawsuit by Exxon Mobil Corp of "a campaign to compete by turning the wheels of American justice to the company's self-interested purposes".

title.children: Andrew Forrest charity named in ExxonMobil defamation lawsuit

image.altText: Cynthia Erivo, in green make up and a witch's costume, next to Ariana Grande wearing pink.

props.synopsis: Aussie Cate Blanchett is among the contenders for best TV actress, as Ariana Grande, Pamela Anderson and Timothée Chalamet also receive nods in the movie categories.

title.children: Wicked tops wildfire-disrupted Screen Actors Guild nominations

image.altText: A woman sitting at a table, smiling.

props.synopsis: Vitamin B6 is present in thousands of products in Australia, but doctors are warning patients are risking lifelong damage due to overconsumption of the supplement.

title.children: Rising cases of vitamin B6 toxicity causing concerns for peak medical bodies

image.altText: A Fijian man in a green jacket and tropical-printed shirt, with a bald head, stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: Moe Turaga would work over 60 hours a week, seven days, on a grape farm on the Victoria/NSW border. Two years into his work, Mr Turaga discovered he had not been paid a cent.

title.children: Moe Turaga came to Australia for a better life. He became a victim of modern slavery

image.altText: a man standing with his arms folded next to a makeshift camp

props.synopsis: Homelessness has been rising across the country along with the cost of everyday necessities such as housing, food and electricity. Mick is asking for more support and less judgement for those, like himself, who are trying to turn their luck around.

title.children: Call for understanding as number of people sleeping rough in Adelaide rises

image.altText: A happy, smiling pilot sits on steps leading up to a plane.

props.synopsis: The pilot of a seaplane that plunged into the ocean off Rottnest Island shortly after take off, killing three people, is identified as James Wong.

title.children: Pilot in fatal Rottnest Island seaplane crash identified

props.synopsis: After playing a basketball match for 120 hours straight, Alan Morris's side had finally broken a world record. Or at least they thought they had until a paperwork bungle held up official recognition.

title.children: Admin bungle causes 52-year wait for official basketball world record

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, standing on a stage, wearing a black t-shirt, talking at a company conference.

props.synopsis: Social media giant Meta has announced an Elon Musk-inspired solution to replace its independent fact-checking model on its platforms. Community Notes has been praised by its creator, but how effective is at curbing misinformation?

title.children: Meta opts to leave fact-checking to unpaid users. What could go wrong?

image.altText: Zuckerberg Albanese Trump composite

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has defended his social media policies after the Meta chief pledged to work with Trump to fight government "censorship".

title.children: Albanese defends teen social media ban as Meta fights government 'censorship'

image.altText: A man with shaggy dark hair and blue eyes reclines in a chair

props.synopsis: Once dismissed as "the Paris Hilton of Canadian politics", Justin Trudeau defied expectations by holding onto power for almost a decade. But his tumultuous period in office was often defined by scandals of his own making.

title.children: Trudeau entered office with his wife and best friend. He left politics alone

image.altText: Jai Opetaia punches David Nyika

props.synopsis: Jai Opetaia retains his IBF and The Ring cruiserweight world titles by knocking out David Nyika in the fourth round.

title.children: Jai Opetaia retains world titles with brutal knockout of David Nyika

image.altText: AC/DC's Angus Young performs live, wearing blue schoolboy outfit and playing black guitar, at London's Wembley Stadium

props.synopsis: Sydney developers have apologised for the demolition of the historic childhood home of AC/DC's Angus and Malcolm Young.

title.children: AC/DC childhood home accidentally demolished by Sydney developers

image.altText: A coloured graphic showing a petrol pump, coins, keys and a bag of fresh groceries against a backdrop of receipts

props.synopsis: A fall in the Reserve Bank's preferred measure of inflation has increased the odds of an interest rate cut in February.

title.children: Falling core inflation raises odds of RBA trimming rates in February

image.altText: Man wearing face mask sitting at Brisbane bus stop, bus blurred in the background

props.synopsis: Human metapneumovirus is a respiratory infection that usually causes mild cold and flu symptoms, but it can be more serious for people with other health conditions.

title.children: HMPV is spreading through China. But the virus has actually been around for decades

image.altText: A car on fire in Halls Creek.

props.synopsis: Police say vehicles were driven at pedestrians, a man was attacked and several fires were started during a chaotic day of violence in Halls Creek.

title.children: Axe attack, cars set alight, multiple arrests, as extra police deployed to WA town

image.altText: Spirit of Tasmania IV ship in port.

props.synopsis: Finnish-built engines have joined the list of "local content" mandated in the fit-out of Tasmania's two new Spirit ferries.

title.children: Spirit ferries' $100m of 'local content' includes Finnish-built engines

image.altText: A funnel-web spider next to a 50 cent coin.

props.synopsis: The Australian Reptile Park has received its biggest funnel-web spider to date, who they've named Hemsworth after the famous Aussie brothers.

title.children: Mammoth funnel-web spider named Hemsworth to be milked to help save lives

image.altText: A man with a beard in a yellow sports jersey holds a rugby ball

props.synopsis: The Papua New Guinean government says it will cooperate with any official request to send former Bradford Bulls player Keven Appo back to England, where he is due to front court on charges of rape, sexual assault of a female and two counts of assault.

title.children: Rugby league player in the UK flees home to PNG after rape charges

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a blue suit and red tie as he looks to his side while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: US president-elect Donald Trump refuses to rule out using the military to seize control of Greenland and the Panama Canal.

title.children: Trump refuses to rule out using military to seize Greenland and Panama Canal

image.altText: Rows of police officers in dark uniforms stand looking away from the camera in front of a brick building with a tower.

props.synopsis: Police said the Office of Public Prosecutions had determined there was no reasonable prospect of convicting the accused officer.

title.children: No charges after allegations Victorian police officer made Nazi salute

image.altText: A blank working with vulnerable people card from Tasmania.

props.synopsis: There are renewed calls from local councillors and state MPs for Working with Vulnerable People cards to be made mandatory for elected officials.

title.children: Gibson speaks out amid push for mandatory checks for elected officials

image.altText: Shamar Joseph runs with his arms out

props.synopsis: Reports that the ICC is investigating a two-tiered Test league alarms some of the game's stakeholders but others say there is little other choice.

title.children: Two-tier Test plan seen as 'terrible', 'greedy' and inevitable

image.altText: Maya Joint plays a forehand at the Brisbane International.

props.synopsis: At just 18, Maya Joint is through to the last eight for the first time at a top-level event after beating former Australian Open semifinalist Magda Linette in Hobart.

title.children: Emerging Aussie star advances to Hobart International quarterfinals

image.altText: A close up shot of the Aedes aegypti mosquito, which carries the dengue fever virus.

props.synopsis: A study on fruit flies completed by researchers with Macquarie University suggests that genetic modification of male mosquitoes could help minimise the spread of illnesses linked with the insects.

title.children: Scientists find 'toxic male technique' could reduce mosquito disease
